description: The material instances for a block. Maps face or material_instance names in a geometry file to an actual material instance. You can assign a material instance object to any of these faces: 'up', 'down', 'north', 'south', 'east', 'west', or '*'. You can also give an instance the name of your choosing such as 'my_instance', and then assign it to a face by doing 'north':'my_instance'.

texture.description: Name of a texture from the terrain_texture.json file.

oneOf.description: Used for a regular block texture without an alpha layer. Does not allow for transparency or translucency. This material enables AO (ambient occlusion) for the block, creating shadows around and underneath it.
Used for a block like stained glass. Allows for transparency and translucency (slightly transparent textures). By default, this material disables AO for the block.

Used for a block like the vanilla (unstained) glass. Does not allow for translucency, only fully opaque or fully transparent textures. By default, this material disables AO for the block, removing those ugly shadows if you're making a non-full or decorative block.
Used for completely disabling backface culling.

ambient_occlusion.description: Should this material have ambient occlusion applied when lighting? If true, shadows will be created around and underneath the block.

face_dimming.description: Should this material have ambient occlusion applied when lighting.
